address: Xã Minh Sơn, Huyện Thanh Chương, Tỉnh Nghệ An
thought:
**Analyzing the Address and Determining the New Administrative Unit**

Okay, so I've got "Xã Minh Sơn, Huyện Thanh Chương, Tỉnh Nghệ An" as the input address. My task is to figure out the new administrative unit after any potential merges. I need to comb through these resolutions and the "New wards" data.

First, I checked Province Resolutions (60-NQ/TW) to make sure there weren't any province-level changes. Luckily, Nghệ An is listed as not being merged, so that clears that up.

Next, I jumped into the detailed resolutions. I knew 1678/NQ-UBTVQH15 was the one for Nghệ An. My primary target was "Minh Sơn" in "Thanh Chương". Initially, I had to dismiss resolution section which was about "Minh Sơn" in "Đô Lương", not my area. Then, jackpot! Resolution point 87 perfectly matched the criteria: "Minh Sơn (huyện Thanh Chương)" is being absorbed into "xã Cát Ngạn."

I quickly scanned the other resolutions, like the ones about Tuyên Quang and Thanh Hóa, but those weren't relevant. I also checked sections relating to other areas of Thanh Chương, but they were not matches.

Now, I switched to the "New wards" list. Based on the resolution, I went straight to search for "xã Cát Ngạn." And there it was! The data confirmed: "Xã Cát Ngạn" is indeed the new ward for my address.

Given the explicit nature of the resolution, the connection is direct, without room for misinterpretation. Therefore, my confidence level is high. Now, I'll package this into a JSON output.

citation.header: 1678/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Nghệ An
citation.line: 87. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Minh Sơn (huyện Thanh Chương), Cát Văn và Phong Thịnh thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Cát Ngạn.
